Barcelona forward Neymar has now told Paris Saint-Germain he wants to move to the Parc des Princes and agreed terms on a contract, a source close to the French club has told ESPN FC.

His decision means PSG can now push forward with their plans to trigger the Brazil international's €222 million buyout clause.

The source said Neymar and his father, who has been in discussions with PSG's ambitious Qatari owners and sporting director Antero Henrique for the past few days, have agreed to a massive contract at least four years in length.

If the 25-year-old ends up in Paris, he will be earning approximately €30m a year after taxes and will also be handed an astronomic signing on fee in excess of his net annual sum.

MESSI'S FAVOURITE NEYMAR REPLACEMENTS

Lionel Messi has given Barcelona a list of candidates he wants to replace Neymar should he join Paris Saint-Germain, according to Don Balon.

PSG are ready to lure Neymar to the French capital by matching his €222 million release clause, leaving Barca in the hunt for a new star attacker.

Messi has endorsed Paulo Dybala for the role and the Juventus attacker is said to be the club's main candidate. Should they fail in that pursuit, though, Messi wants them to go after PSG's Angel Di Maria or Borussia Dortmund attacker Ousmane Dembele.

This could be a big week for Arsenal fans with PSG expected to make their move for Alexis Sanchez. We understand they will make a £35m offer because they know he has only 12 months left on his Arsenal deal. His representatives have been asking PSG for a contract worth £500,000 a week contract.
It's a similar story with Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain. He's only got 12 months left on his contract. We are told Chelsea will make their move for him this week and Liverpool are also interested.

PERISIC LATEST

One player Manchester United are definitely trying to sign is Ivan Perisic, but Inter Milan are still asking for £48m.

Inter manager Luciano Spalletti has said he doesn't want to sell Perisic, but would let him leave for the right offer.
(Skysports)

PERISIC LATEST

One player Manchester United are definitely trying to sign is Ivan Perisic, but Inter Milan are still asking for £48m.

Inter manager Luciano Spalletti has said he doesn't want to sell Perisic, but would let him leave for the right offer.
(Skysports)

UNITED'S MIDFIELD OPTIONS

We are told United have made a £40m bid for Eric Dier, but that has not been confirmed by either club. Tottenham are in a very strong position as they don't want to sell and Dier signed a new five-year contract last September.
Marco Verratti was not on United's list of summer targets, but that might have changed. The PSG midfielder has switched agents and signed up with Mino Raiola.
Renato Sanches was not on United's original list either. He's been told he can leave Bayern Munich for £42m and has the same agent as Jose Mourinho in Jorge Mendes.
Nemanja Matic is available and Chelsea are willing to sell him to United. But we are told clubs in Italy - like Juventus - want him more than United at the moment.
Another midfielder United have looked at is Roma's Radja Nainggolan. We reported in May that talks had been held about signing him. But at the moment he is much more likely to sign a new contract at Roma.
